Create Wave Exposure Grid Polygons

create_wave_grid.Rd

This function builds an unstructured grid of polygons along a reef/shoreline line, joins wave exposure metrics to the polygons, and returns the grid ready for mapping.

Usage

create_wave_grid(line, waves, interval = 50, width = 50)

Arguments

line

An sf or sfc LINESTRING object representing the reef or shoreline boundary.

waves

An sf object returned by calculate_wave_exposure() containing wave metrics at points.

interval

Numeric. Spacing between sample points along the line (map units, e.g. meters).

width

Numeric. Total buffer width around the line (map units, e.g. meters).

Value

An sf polygon grid with the wave metrics columns joined.

Details

  • Points are sampled along the input line at interval spacing.

  • A Voronoi tessellation is created from those points and clipped to a corridor width wide.

  • Each polygon is assigned wave metrics from the nearest sampled point.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
grid <- create_wave_grid(whitsundays_union, whitsundays_waves, interval = 50, width = 20)
} # }
